member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState.GetNumPacks(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a sample count and a number of samples per pack and returns the total number of packs. This includes a potentially *partial* final pack.
member.returns: The number of packs available.
member.param: The total sample count to use.
The number of samples per pack to use in the calculation.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState.GetFirstVisiblePack
member.summary: Gets the number of the first visible pack.
member.returns: The number of the first visible pack of samples.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState.GetFirstVisiblePackSample
member.summary: Gets the sample index that represents the first visible pack of samples.
member.returns: The sample index of the first visible pack of samples.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState.GetWaveformInset
member.summary: Gets the amount the waveform is kicked into the view.
member.returns: The waveform inset.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState.GetNumPacks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Given the sample count, this will return the total number of sample packs available. It includes a potentially *partial* final pack.
member.returns: The number packs available.
member.param: The total sample count to use.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState.GetMaxPackPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of firstPackPos when fully scrolled. Note that this value is probably very negative.
member.returns: The position of the firstPackPos when fully scrolled.
member.param: The total number of packs in consideration.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor
member.summary: The Koreography Editor. This is the main UI for editing Koreography and Koreography Tracks.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.TheEditor
member.summary: Gets a reference to the Koreography Editor window. Null if not open.
member.value: The Koreography Editor window. This is null if not open.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.AssetPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the most recently used asset directory in the current project.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.WaveStartPositionOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset in units for the edge of the WaveDisplay content from the edge of the EditorWindow.
member.value: The number of units between the edge of the EditorWindow and the beginning of the Waveform display.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.OpenKoreography(SonicBloom.Koreo.Koreography,SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase)
member.summary: Opens in the Koreography Editor, optionally selecting .
member.param: The Koreography to open.
The Koreography Track to highlight.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.CreateNewKoreography
member.summary: Opens an OS "File Save" dialog with which the user may select the location and name at which to create a Koreography asset. If one is specified, this creates and returns a new Koreography asset.
member.returns: The newly created Koreography asset if one was created, null otherwise.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.CreateNewKoreographyTrack(System.Type)
member.summary: Opens an OS "File Save" dialog with which the user may select the location and name at which to create a Koreography Track asset. If one is specified, this creates and returns a new Koreography Track asset.
member.returns: The newly created Koreography Track asset if one was created, null otherwise.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.GetFriendlyNameOfPayloadType(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the Friendly Name of the [payload] type passed in by invoking the "GetFriendlyName" function of the type.
member.returns: The friendly name of payload type.
member.param: The type of the payload for which to retreive the name.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.IsAudioClipValid(UnityEngine.AudioClip)
member.summary: Determines if is okay for editing in the Koreography Editor (if AudioClip.GetData() will return usable data). By default, AudioClips are *not* valid.
member.returns: true if will work with the Koreography Editor; otherwise, false.
member.param: The AudioClip to check.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.CheckAudioClipValidity(UnityEngine.AudioClip)
member.summary: Checks for validity. If is invalid it will pop up a dialog asking if the user wishes to take action to correct the issue. If so, this causes a quick reimport of the .
member.returns: true if will work with the Koreography Editor; otherwise, false.
member.param: The AudioClip to check.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.GetSystemDisabledAudioProperty
member.summary: Caches and returns a reference to the SerializedProperty that wraps the AudioManager's DisabledAudio system property.
member.returns: The cached SerializedProperty wrapper for the DisableAudio setting.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.GetAudioSystemDisabled
member.summary: Checks whether Unity's internal Audio System is disabled. This value is typically set with the "Disable Audio" setting in Edit->Project Settings->Audio.
member.returns: true, if the audio system is disabled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.SetAudioSystemDisabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables or enables Unity's Audio system for the current project. This modifies the setting stored in "ProjectSettings/AudioManager.asset".
member.param: Disables Unity Audio if set to true, otherwise enables it.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEditor.DuplicateEventsAtLocation(System.Collections.Generic.List{SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyEvent},System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Duplicates the events in the source list beginning at the specified location, recording them as the operation for the Undo system.
member.param: Events to duplicate.
The position to seed the duplication.
The Operation to record this as, in single (made multiple internally).

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyEventExtensions
member.summary: Extra KoreographyEvent methods for editor purposes!

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.EventDisplay.DrawPayload(UnityEngine.Rect,SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase,SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyEvent,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws the payload. DOES NOT do a null-check on the Payload or the KoreographyEvent. Assumes both are valid.
member.param: The Rect into which to draw the UI.
The Koreography Track this Payload is found within.
The KoreographyEvent containing the Payload to draw.
Is selected if set to true.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.PayloadDisplay
member.summary: Handles drawing the Editor GUI for payloads. In early Koreographer builds, this functionality was implemented with inheritance of the Payload itself. Due to packaging requirements in Unity 4.5/4.6, this method is not viable. As such we use the dispatch method that "simulates" the vtable. This is ever-so-slightly slower (testing on Mid-2012 MBP with Retina reveals ~1.6% slower).

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplay.GetSamplePositionOfPoint(UnityEngine.Vector2,SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.WaveDisplayState)
member.summary: Gets the sample position of the specified point. This is guaranteed positive and is NOT bound by the length of the song. Please check that the value returned is within the range you need.
member.returns: The sample position of the requested point.
member.param: The location to test.
The current display state of the Wave Display.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.UnityTools.KoreographyInspector
member.summary: The custom Editor for Koreography. This class customizes Koreography in the Inspector.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.UnityTools.KoreographyPropertyDrawer
member.summary: Custom Property Drawer for Koreography. This class customizes the representation of Koreography when used as a property of other classes, behaviours, etc.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.UnityTools.KoreographyTrackInspector
member.summary: The custom Editor for Koreography Tracks. This class customizes Koreography Tracks in the Inspector.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.UnityTools.MusicLayerPropertyDrawer
member.summary: Custom Property Drawer for the MusicLayer. This class customizes the representation of MusicLayers when used as a property of other classes, behaviours, etc.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.MIDIConverter.MIDIPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a valid version of the last path used from the EditorPrefs system. This is a path to a directory, not a file.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.MIDIConverter.GetScrollViewHeight
member.summary: Calculates the size of the scroll view based on current window size, start position, and some spacing rules. This is currently shared across multiple views. Break it up if UI layouts change!
member.returns: The height of flexible scroll views.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.MIDIConverter.CheckUpdateScrollStartPos
member.summary: Sets, if necessary, the start y position of the scroll views. This must be calculated in the Repaint OnGUI flow because GetLastRect doesn't return usable values in Layout OnGUI. Annoyingly, the sizing values appear to only be cared about on the Layout OnGUI pass.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.TrackContainer.RestoreTrack(SonicBloom.MIDI.Objects.Track)
member.summary: Restores the track reference, reconnecting all internal Channel references.
member.returns: true, if the track was restored, false otherwise.
member.param: The track to restore.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.ChannelContainer.ChannelNum
member.summary: Returns the ChannelNumber assigned to the MIDI Channel in this Container. This is the "name" of the channel, not the index [1, 16].

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.AudioAnalysis
member.summary: The AudioAnalysis static class collects methods used in audio analysis together into one place.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.AudioAnalysis.ComputeRMS(System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the Root Mean Square of the collection of samples.
member.returns: The Root Mean Square of the .
member.param: The samples to compute.
Number samples to use from the array.

* Initialize class to perform FFT of specified size. * * @param logN Log2 of FFT length. e.g. for 512 pt FFT, logN = 9.
* Performs in-place complex FFT. * * @param xRe Real part of input/output * @param xIm Imaginary part of input/output * @param inverse If true, do an inverse FFT
* Do bit reversal of specified number of places of an int * For example, 1101 bit-reversed is 1011 * * @param x Number to be bit-reverse. * @param numBits Number of bits in the number.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.UnityTools.EventIDPropertyDrawer
member.summary: Custom Property Drawer for the EventIDAttribute. This class customizes the representation of fields marked with either [EventID] or [EventIDAttribute].

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.CustomAssetUtility
member.summary: Utility class to help with generating Assets in earlier versions of Unity.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.CustomAssetUtility.CreateAsset``1(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an asset at the location of the current "active (selected) object". If none exists, it defaults to "Assets". In Unity 5.1 and above, use the built-in [CreateAssetMenuAttribute] instead.
member.param: File extension to use.
member.typeparam: The specific type of asset to create.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyTrackTypeUtils.GetTrackTypes(System.Boolean)

member.returns: A System.TypeList containing all types that subclass the KoreographyTrackBase class in the current AppDomain.
member.param: Whether or not to exclude Track Types with the NoEditorCreate Attribute set.

member.returns: A dictionary that maps Koreography Track types to the Payload types they support.
member.param: If set to true Track types with the [NoEditorCreate] Attribute will be excluded.
If set to true Payload types with the [NoEditorCreate] Attribute will be excluded.

Whether or not to exclude Payload Types with the NoEditorCreate Attribute set.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographyTrackTypeUtils.GetAllPayloadTypes(System.Boolean)

member.returns: A System.TypeList containing all types that implement the IPayload interface in the current AppDomain.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographerGUIUtils.DrawSpectrumGUI(UnityEngine.Rect,System.Single[])

The spectrum data to render into the .

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographerGUIUtils.CustomObjectField(UnityEngine.Rect,UnityEngine.Object)

summary.para: Draws an Editor Field for a given UnityEngine.Object. This version does not include the little selector icon towards the back of the field.
Left-clicking the field will open the Object Picker. Right-clicking will select the object (if one exists) in the Project View.

member.returns: A reference to a UnityEngine.Object instance or null.
member.param: The Rect within which to draw the control.
The UnityEngine.Object reference to show with this control.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.EditorUI.KoreographerGUIUtils.ShowTypeSelectorMenu(UnityEngine.Rect,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Type},UnityEditor.GenericMenu.MenuFunction2)
member.summary: Shows a dropdown menu (via GenericMenu) with options specified in the parameter. If a selection occurs, the function will be called and passed the System.Type as the function's data parameter. If there is only one option, the function will be called immediately and no menu will be shown.
member.param: The position of the element over which to draw the menu.
The types to show in the list.
On new track option selected.
